intro: Pluchea boivinii, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of branches. Pluchea boivinii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
